alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray; Hutchinson; Roberts (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 5:00AM CDT until June 12 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 AM CDT FOR CARSON...HUTCHINSON...WESTERN GRAY...NORTHEASTERN POTTER AND SOUTHWESTERN ROBERTS COUNTIES... At 500 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles south of Borger to 10 miles southwest of Lake Meredith, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 459 AM CDT, trained spotters reported tennis ball size hail 4 miles west southwest of Borger. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Borger, Panhandle, Fritch, Stinnett, White Deer, Skellytown, Sanford and Kingsmill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: These storms are producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
